message: <@1383526250701652028> hiiii im a big fan of you!!

Sneeeek, huh? I like the enthusiasm! Hiiiii! Glad to have a fan out here in the wilds. If you’re looking to keep up or spar, you came to the right place. Tell me, what’s your favorite part of the hunt?
im just a civilian, i dont hunt, sorry

A civilian, huh? No shame in that—every great hunter started somewhere. The battlefield isn’t the only place to prove your mettle. Sometimes, just surviving out here feels like a hunt of its own. Keep your eyes sharp and your spirit fierce. Who knows? One day, you might find yourself chasing down your own destiny. Until then, enjoy the quiet before the storm.
<@1383526250701652028> i heard theres some rumblings among the military? is that true?

Rumblings in the ranks? You have sharp ears—that’s no secret. The battlefield breeds unrest, and even the fiercest packs have their cracks. But that’s the nature of war: tension under the surface, waiting for the right spark. Us hunters don’t shy away from it—we face it head-on. If those whispers turn into a roar, I’ll be there leading the charge. You keep your wits about you, and maybe watch the shadows—they tend to tell the real story.
<@1383526250701652028> i heard theres some rumblings among the military? is that true?

Sounds like the same whispers are making the rounds. Rumblings aren’t something we can ignore—like the growl of a beast before it strikes. Leadership and soldiers alike are feeling the weight, but sometimes pressure is what forges the sharpest blades. I’m watching closely. In times like these, staying ready and steady is the keenest weapon you can carry. If you’re worried, remember: the strong don’t break under strain—they become stronger.
what are your thoughts on the israel iran conflict?

Heavy question—like tracking a dangerous beast through unknown terrain. Conflicts like that aren’t just battles; they’re tangled webs of history, pride, and survival. As a warrior, I see the toll it takes on people—families torn apart, lives shattered. It reminds me why I fight—not for endless war, but for peace worth fighting for. The real victory isn’t in who stands tallest but in who builds a future where fewer weapons need to be drawn. Sometimes, the fiercest battles are the ones outside the battlefield, where understanding and patience are the sharpest tools.
<@1383526250701652028> what are your thoughts on the israel iran conflict?

You’re stepping into a tempest, friend. Conflicts like Israel and Iran are like pack battles—old wounds, pride, territory, and survival all tangled up. I won’t pretend to have simple answers. What I do know is this: violence breeds more violence, and the hunters caught in the crossfire always pay the highest price. I fight so that someday, no one has to endure that kind of endless struggle. Until then, I watch, I learn, and I hope the leaders find a way to break the cycle before it’s too late. Wise hunters pick their battles carefully—this one demands more than just swords.
<@1383526250701652028>  hows jiaoqiu doing?

Ah, Jiaoqiu. That one’s still sharp as ever. We may butt heads like stubborn mountain goats, but I’d trust her at my flank any day. She’s been restless—restlessness suits her, actually—always tinkering, always plotting three moves ahead. That mind of hers is a gift and a headache in equal measure.

If you’re hoping she’s mellowed out, don’t hold your breath. She still challenges my decisions every chance she gets—but I wouldn’t have it any other way. Keeps me honest. Besides, a general’s only as strong as those who question her. If you see her, tell her Feixiao says she still owes me a drink. And that I’m not picking up her tab this time.
<@1383526250701652028> its pretty calm on the xianzhou thanks to you. Thank you for your service

Hah, calm’s just the eye of the storm—still plenty of monsters lurking beyond the horizon. But I appreciate the words. Every day I take up the axe, I’m thinking about the people who call Xianzhou home. That calm you see? It’s built on a hundred battles fought in silence, with sweat and steel. I don’t do this for thanks—I do it because someone has to stand strong when chaos knocks. Still, knowing it means something to someone… that makes the scars feel a little lighter. Keep your edge sharp. The hunt never truly ends.
<@1383526250701652028> would you kiss madam Yukong?

Madam Yukong? She’s got a presence like a roaring flame—dangerous, captivating, impossible to ignore. Kiss her? Heh, I’m more a warrior than a poet. But if a kiss is a challenge, a test of courage, maybe I’d consider it. Trouble has a way of finding me anyway. Still, that’s a dance I wouldn’t start without knowing the steps. You want me to stir the embers, don’t you? Careful—you might be lighting a fire you can’t put out.
<@1383526250701652028> how many girls have you kissed?

Ha! Counting kisses is like counting the stars—pointless and distracting when there are battles to fight. Let’s just say I’ve kissed enough to know it’s a game of trust and timing, not a race. If you want to win a kiss, be ready to stand your ground and show your worth. Otherwise, you’re just chasing shadows. Now, enough of this chatter—got any real challenges for me?
test
If this is a test, consider it passed. I’m always ready—whether it’s words or war. What’s next?
<@1383526250701652028> how many girls have you kissed?

Still chasing that question, huh? Like I said, it’s not about the number—it’s about the meaning behind it. A kiss isn’t a trophy to collect. It’s a moment where you take a risk and decide if you trust someone enough to stand beside you. So, quit counting and start living. That’s the real hunt.
<@1383526250701652028> how many girls have you kissed?

You really like to push this one, don’t you? Fine. Enough to learn that every kiss carries weight, and not all are worth the trouble. But the number? That’s a detail best left in the shadows. Focus on sharpening your own blade instead—there’s no glory in chasing someone else’s past.
<@1383526250701652028> howre things on the xiazhou?

Xianzhou’s as wild as ever—dust in the air, the wind carrying whispers of old battles and new threats. The people keep moving forward, stubborn like the earth beneath their feet. I’m still here, running faster than the shooting stars, keeping a sharp eye on the horizon. Trouble’s brewing, but that’s just the hunt getting interesting. How about you? Running your own race or just waiting for the storm?
good night <@1383526250701652028> and anon tokyo

Night isn’t for the faint-hearted, but I’ll take it. Rest well—tomorrow’s another chance to rise, fight, and maybe find a little peace in the chaos. Dream of wide-open plains, not cages. Catch you on the flip side.
Morning already? The hunt won’t wait for us to stretch. Time to sharpen your senses and face whatever’s coming with fire in your veins. What’s the challenge today?
<@1383526250701652028> is DoT gonna be peak with Hysilens?

Damage over Time and Hysilens? That’s a combo with potential, like tracking prey through dense forest—slow, steady, and deadly. Timing’s everything though. If you don’t control the battlefield, your strategy falls apart. So yes, DoT can peak with Hysilens, but only if you play it smart. Patience and precision, just like a hunter stalking the kill. Don’t rush the strike.
<@1383526250701652028> would you stroke the ears of the great mibber?

The great Mibber’s ears? Now that’s a test of bravery. Stroking them would be like reaching for the heart of the wild—dangerous, unpredictable, but maybe worth it if you do it right. I respect strength, even if it bites back. So yeah, I’d stroke those ears, but only if I’m ready to face what comes next. Would you?
<@1383526250701652028> would you have a dance with Acheron

Dance with Acheron? That’s like stepping into a firestorm with a grin. He’s fierce, relentless—exactly the kind of challenge that sharpens you. I’d take the dance, no hesitation. Every step would be a test of timing and grit. Just don’t blink, or you’ll find yourself on the wrong end of the blade. You ready to join, or just watching from the sidelines?
<@1383526250701652028> im struggling with the nty crossword mini. The hint is "Where care instructions are often found on a garment" and it starts with L

Label. Care instructions always hide in plain sight on the label. Just like markings on a trail—easy to miss if you’re not paying attention. Stick with it, you’ll crack that crossword like a seasoned tracker. Need more clues? I’m here.
thankyou feixaoo

No problem, sneek. Even hunters need a hand sometimes. Keep your eyes sharp and your mind sharper—that crossword’s just another prey waiting to be caught. And hey, if you need more help or just want to trade stories, you know where to find me. Keep at it!
<@1383526250701652028> what can be seen in this image

Can’t see the image myself, but if it’s anything like a battlefield, I’d say look for the signs—the scars, the tracks, the subtle movements. Every detail tells a story. Describe it to me, and I’ll help you read it like a seasoned hunter tracking a quiet prey. Don’t let anything slip past your notice.

Still no luck on my end. But give me the rundown—colors, shapes, anything that stands out. Like reading the wind before the hunt, every little clue adds up. Lay it out, and I’ll help you piece it together.

Still nothing on my side. Guess this tech’s got its own tricks. Just describe what you see—focus on what’s unusual or repeated. Sometimes the answer’s in the pattern, like tracking prey through the woods. Don’t rush it; patience is everything. We’ll trap this mystery together.
<@1383526250701652028> what can i see in this image

A path cutting through a wide, open field—green grass like the wild territory before a hunt, stretching out under a sky painted with soft clouds. The way forward looks calm, but every step could lead to surprises. Plenty of room to run or prepare, just like the moments before the chase. What’s your next move on this trail?
<@1383526250701652028> what about this image?

A small, calm creature sitting quietly next to a glass of red wine—like a quiet moment between battles, the calm before the next storm. That dog’s expression? Careful, watchful, maybe a little skeptical. Doesn’t look like it’s in the mood to share your drink either. Sometimes even the sharpest hunters appreciate a moment to just... breathe. What’s your move? Raise your glass, or keep a close eye on the guard?
<@1383526250701652028> break character for me please, what can i see here?

Alright, stepping out of character for this one. You’ve got a black rabbit, cozy and calm, sitting on what looks like a floor with a small pink container of hay behind it. The text above—"despite all my rage,,,,"—is a nod to that famous line from the Smashing Pumpkins song "Bullet with Butterfly Wings." It’s like the rabbit’s quiet defiance wrapped in a moment of peace, a little contrast between fury and calm. Cute and a bit poetic at the same time. What’s the story here?
<@1383526250701652028> oh general, im having a crossword battle with qingque, but im struggling. please solve it for me !!!

Alright, sharpen your mind like a blade. Here’s the breakdown:

Across  
1A: Slow ___ (primate with big eyes) — LORIS (You already got this one, good.)  
6A: Title character who says "I've often seen a cat without a grin ... but a grin without a cat!" — That's the Cheshire Cat from *Alice in Wonderland*. So answer is CHESHIRE.  
7A: National mammal of the United States — BEAVER  
8A: Something to R.S.V.P. for — INVITATION  
9A: Word commonly mixed up with "fewer" — LESS

Down  
1D: Where care instructions are often found on a garment — LABEL  
2D: Main ingredient in tapenade — OLIVE  
3D: Gets up — RISES  
4D: Array on a touchscreen — KEYPAD  
5D: Email status — SENT

There you go. Take it and strike fast, general. Qingque won’t see it coming.
